learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate effective communication skills that demonstrate a high level of professionalism and are appropriate to the audience (SPA PS Domains/Standards 1.1, 1.5; CBOS Unit 2).
Critically reflect on your professional practice, clinical reasoning and communication skills to inform your ongoing professional development (SPA PS Domains/Standards 2.1, 2.2, 2.3; CBOS Unit 7).

Demonstrate entry-level skills in speech pathology practice, including the assessment, diagnosis, planning, implementation and evaluation of speech pathology services (SPA PS Domains/Standards 3.1 3.5; CBOS Units 1 - 5).
Engage in interprofessional collaborative practice to achieve effective client and community outcomes (SPA PS Domains/Standards 1.3, 1.4, 1.6, 1.7, 3.1, 3.4; CBOS Units 2, 4, 5, 6, 7).
Provide evidence-based rationales for the management approach for clients with communication and/or swallowing difficulties (SPA PS Domains/Standards 1.1, 1.3, 2.2, 2.5, 3.4; CBOS Unit 5).

assessments.due_date: COMPASS®2 Online will be used for this clinical course. Practice educators should complete their final assessments for students 1 week after the completion of the placement.
assessments.task_description:
Student clinical competencies will be assessed using COMPASS®2 Online at the mid- and end point of the placement. 

Students must pass the clinical placement evaluation according to COMPASS®2 criteria in order to pass the course. See SPCH7816 Clinical Course Booklet on the SPCH7816 Blackboard site for criteria for a passing grade for this assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students will be assessed using COMPASSﾮ2 Online.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date:
9/06/2025

Details regarding the start time for your viva will be available in week 13.
assessments.task_description:
This oral examination will be held at a date in the second week of the end of semester exam period. This will be an individual oral examination with one speech pathology staff member. Viva duration will be 35 minutes, including 15 minutes of planning time.


Students will receive written information about two unseen client cases, one paediatric and one adult. Students will have the opportunity to familiarise themselves with the written case details just prior to entering the viva. Within the viva, students will respond to questions relating to the cases and discuss their proposed assessment and management.


Further details about the case preparation, potential discussion points and the assessment of student performance in the clinical viva will be provided during semester.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Clinical viva preparation workshops

Students will participate in a workshop session designed to prepare them for their clinical viva in the end of semester exam period. This workshop will provide students with an opportunity to gain further details about the viva, and discuss the content and structure. Details regarding the timing of this workshop will be provided during semester.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Clinical viva preparation workshops Students will participate in a workshop session designed to prepare them for their clinical viva in the end of semester exam period. This workshop will provide students with an opportunity to gain further details about the viva, and discuss the content and structure. Details regarding the timing of this workshop will be provided during semester.

learning_activities.topic:
Block clinical practicum in external setting

This is the final clinical placement course in the Master of Speech Pathology Studies program. Students are rostered to a paediatric or adult external clinic. Start and finish dates may vary as negotiated with students and practice facilities in a speech pathology environment.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
